transportAdvice: Reykjavik's compact city center is very walkable, with most major attractions within easy reach on foot. A public bus network covers the city and surrounding areas, and taxis are readily available, though they are expensive by international standards.

weather.description: Dark, cold, and stormy with very limited daylight, but prime time for northern lights viewing.
Still cold and wintry with frequent storms, though daylight hours begin to noticeably increase.
Early spring brings slightly milder temperatures and rapidly lengthening days, though snow is still possible.
Conditions improve with longer days and occasional sunshine, though wind and rain remain common.
A pleasant shoulder month with mild temperatures, green landscapes emerging, and extended daylight.
The midnight sun arrives, offering nearly 24 hours of daylight and the most comfortable outdoor conditions of the year.
The warmest month of the year with long bright nights, ideal for hiking and outdoor exploration.
Still warm and bright with gradually shortening nights, remaining one of the best months to visit.
Autumn arrives with cooler temperatures, increased rainfall, and the return of dark enough skies for northern lights.
Noticeably colder and wetter with frequent storms, but northern lights opportunities increase significantly.
Dark and cold with very short days, strong winds, and a wintry atmosphere settling in across the city.
The darkest month of the year with only a few hours of daylight, but festive atmosphere and excellent northern lights conditions.
